Package de.gnwi.mfsim.model.job

Class DistanceDistributionUtils

java.lang.Object
de.gnwi.mfsim.model.job.DistanceDistributionUtils
public class DistanceDistributionUtils extends Object
Utility class for calculation of the frequency of spatial distances between particles in the simulation box used for RDF calculations (PBC in all directions are assumed)
Author:
Mirco Daniel, Achim Zielesny

  • Constructor Details

    • DistanceDistributionUtils

      public DistanceDistributionUtils(double aSegmentLength, double aBoxLengthX, double aBoxLengthY, double aBoxLengthZ)
      Constructor
      Parameters:
      aSegmentLength - Length of distance segment
      aBoxLengthX - Length of box (x)
      aBoxLengthY - Width of box (y)
      aBoxLengthZ - Height of box (z)
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if argument is illegal

  • Method Details

    • getEqualParticlePairDistanceBinFrequencies

      public double[] getEqualParticlePairDistanceBinFrequencies(de.gnwi.spices.PointInSpace[] aParticlePositions)
      Returns the frequencies of the distance bins between equal particle-pair A-A
      Parameters:
      aParticlePositions - Positions of particles A
      Returns:
      Integer array or null if equal particle-pair A-A distribution can not be calculated. Index = Index of distance segment (histogram bin) starting with 0, Integer value = Frequency of particle within distance segment on average

    • getDifferentParticlePairDistanceBinFrequencies

      public double[] getDifferentParticlePairDistanceBinFrequencies(de.gnwi.spices.PointInSpace[] aParticlePositionsA, de.gnwi.spices.PointInSpace[] aParticlePositionsB)
      Returns the frequencies of the distance bins between different particle-pair A-B
      Parameters:
      aParticlePositionsA - Positions of particles A
      aParticlePositionsB - Positions of particles B
      Returns:
      Integer array or null if different particle-pair A-B distribution can not be calculated. Index = Index of distance segment (histogram bin) starting with 0, Integer value = Frequency of particle B within distance segment on average

    • getParticleParticleDistanceBinFrequencies

      public double[][][] getParticleParticleDistanceBinFrequencies(de.gnwi.spices.PointInSpace[][] aParticlePositionMatrix)
      Returns the frequencies of the distance bins between particle types
      Parameters:
      aParticlePositionMatrix - Positions of all particles of simulation box: Index 1 = Index of particle type, index 2 = Position of single particle of specified type
      Returns:
      Integer array or null if particle matrix distribution can not be calculated. Index 1 of array = Index of particle type 1, index 2 = Index of particle type 2, index 3 = index of distance segment (histogram bin) starting with 0, Integer value = Frequency of particle of type 2 within distance segment on average

    • getParticleParticleDistanceBinFrequencies_Old

      public double[][][] getParticleParticleDistanceBinFrequencies_Old(de.gnwi.spices.PointInSpace[][] aParticlePositionMatrix)
      Returns the frequencies of the distance bins between particle types
      Parameters:
      aParticlePositionMatrix - Positions of all particles of simulation box: Index 1 = Index of particle type, index 2 = Position of single particle of specified type
      Returns:
      Integer array or null if particle matrix distribution can not be calculated. Index 1 of array = Index of particle type 1, index 2 = Index of particle type 2, index 3 = index of distance segment (histogram bin) starting with 0, Integer value = Frequency of particle of type 2 within distance segment on average

    • getParticleDistanceDistribution

      public int[][][][] getParticleDistanceDistribution(de.gnwi.spices.PointInSpace[][] aParticlePositionMatrix)
      Returns the segmented distribution of distances between a particle of specific type and all other particles.
      Parameters:
      aParticlePositionMatrix - Positions of all particles of simulation box: Index 1 = Index of particle type, index 2 = Position of single particle of specified type
      Returns:
      Integer array or null if particle matrix distribution can not be calculated. Index 1 of array = Index of particle type, index 2 = Index of single particle of type of index 1, index 3 = index of other particle type (to which distances are calculated), index 4 = index of distance segment
